column3: # Nsim : Number of simulated stocks (
# SimYear : total number of years in simulation
# InitYear : year in which the MSE starts (i.e. the number of years for which there are data going into the first assessment)
# AssessmentType : 1=Production, 2=Age-structured)
# FisheryIndepenDat : Included fishery independent survey in assessment?
# LifeHistoryPlots : Plot the life history?
# EstimationPlots : Plot the diagnostics for each assessment run? (changes by assessment)
# AssessmentData : plot the data for assessment
# CatchCVn : CV of catch in Box 1
# CatchCVs : CV of catch in Box 2
# CPUEcvN : CV of CPUE in Box 1
# CPUEcvS : CV of CPUE in Box 2
# IndexCVn : CV of survey in Box 1
# IndexCVs : CV of survey in Box 2
# LenSampleN : Number of length samples from box 1
# LenSampleS : Number of length samples from box 2
# GrowthSDn : standard deviation of growth in box 1
# GrowthSDs : standard deviation of growth in box 2

column1: #  can be a vector of the length of the total
#  number of years in the simulation

column3: # DiffFlag : are there differences between the north and south in population processes?
# if '0', the "Box 2" parameters below will be ignored
# MaxAge : maximum age
# NatMn : natural mortality
# VonKn : Von Bertalannfy K
# LinfN : Maximum length (L infinity)
# t0n : t zero in Von Bert
# mat50n : age at 50% maturity
# mat95n : age at 95% maturity
# alphaN : alpha in weight at length (a*L^b)
# betaN : beta  in weight at length (a*L^b)
# MaxMovingN : maximum proportion moving by age (scales a logistic curve)
# Move50n : age at 50% moving (before application of scaling by maximum proportion moving at age)
# Move95n : age at 95% moving (before application of scaling by maximum proportion moving at age)
# steepnessN : stock recruit parameter
# sigmaRn : variability around the recruitment curve
# RzeroN : virgin recruitment
# sel50n : length at 50% selection in the fishery
# sel95n : length at 95% selection in the fishery
# surv50n : length at 50% selection in the survey
# surv95n : length at 95% selection in the survey

column1: #==If there are differences between areas (i.e. DIFF FLAG above is '1') =
#= Fill out the below, if flag is '0', ignore 'Box 2 life history'      =

column3: # NatMs : natural mortality
# VonKs : Von Bertalannfy K
# LinfS : Maximum length (L infinity)
# t0s : t zero in Von Bert
# mat50s : age at 50% maturity
# mat95s : age at 95% maturity
# alphaS : alpha in weight at length (a*L^b)
# betaS : beta  in weight at length (a*L^b)
# MaxMovingS : maximum proportion moving by age (scales a logistic curve)
# Move50s : age at 50% moving (before application of scaling by maximum proportion moving at age)
# Move95s : age at 95% moving (before application of scaling by maximum proportion moving at age)
# steepnessS : stock recruit parameter
# sigmaRs : variability around the recruitment curve
# RzeroS : virgin recruitment
# sel50s : length at 50% selection in the fishery
# sel95s : length at 95% selection in the fishery
# surv50s : length at 50% selection in the survey
# surv95s : length at 95% selection in the survey

column1: #= Fishing mortality can be a single value, or a vector the length of the 'historic' fishery=

column3: # HistoricalF : fishing mortality over the historic period (i.e. the number of years designated as the year in which the MSE starts above)
# depletion : the proportion of virgin biomass management starts, set to zero, the actual F  from Historic F above is used to intialize the population
# CatchShareN : Amount of the total allowable catch taken from Box 1
# HarvestControl : 1 = FMSY; 2 = constant catch, 3 = constant F; 4 = 40/10,
# ConstantCatch : if above ==2, this sets the constant catch
# ConstantF : if above == 3, this sets the constant F applied
# HCalpha : this defines the slope of the control rule
# HCbeta : this defines the proportion of target biomass at which no fishing occurs
# SmallNum : a small number added to log calculations to avoid taking the log of zero
# InitSmooth : smoothness for initial size comps
# FmortPen : a smoothness penalty for F
# RecruitPen : a smoothness penalty for Recruitment devs
